Dear list-members,

I had some problems when I started to use JUnit, a
week ago. After some research, I figure out that the
problem was the J2ME sandbox. I created my first test
case to test a simple class used by a MIDlet, and it
didn't work because it's not possible to do something
like that:

public static void main (String args[])
{
       The J2ME code...
}

And i think that what the framework do, right? Well,
as I said before, it's impossible to do that because
of the J2ME sandbox. I looked for some kind of recipe
in the JUnit Recipes book, but I didn't find anything
about that or about other kinds of sandbox tests
(Indeed, i didn't looked in J2EE chapters, maybe
there's something about test a servlet, but I'm not so
sure if it also has a sandbox concept). So, do you
know a solution to my problem?

Brunno Silva

subject: J2ME and JUnit
